inn1.comm: this is on the middle and easily flicked to deep square leg for a couple of runs. He got a first-ball duck in the last game, so a good start for him
he fishes for this wider delivery and makes no contact, two slips are waiting for those ones
full and swinging in, the batsman goes forward to push it to the off, but gets an inside edge towards midwicket
back of length delivery on the body, the batsman goes on the back foot and comfortably tucks it past the square leg fielder
he strives for swing with a full delivery, but the batsman was waiting for it. He drives it to the on side, but straight to midwicket
back of length on off, the batsman gets behind it solidly and defends it to off
he throws this one wide outside off and Dilshan needs no invitation, he flashes his bat at that, but makes no connection
another wide delivery, Dilshan presses forward and punches it firmly to mid-off
he gets his first runs with an edge to the third-man boundary. Dilshan was again looking for a drive, but the edge flies past the second slip
this one is no edge, it's off the middle of the bat and that has sprinted to the cover boundary! Milne keeping the same full and wide line.
now he pulls the length back and Dilshan has a little poke at it, but pulls the bat in at the last moment
gets some inward movement from a short of length, the batsman defends it off the back foot
fuller length delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to mid-off

Neesham at square leg is not sure, but is that out or not? Umpires are checking. It was a full delivery, swinging in and Dimuth whipped it with the movement. He played it slightly in the air and Neesham had to dive forward to swoop it, but he is not really sure, despite all the fielders congratulating him. That looks ok to me, he has dived forward and to his left and just picked it up in the nick of time. Dimuth is gone, second failure for him in the series
tries to intimidate Sanga with a bouncer first up, but the batsman ducks under it well in time
follows it up with an attempted yorker on off stump, Sanga has no problems with that too, he pushes it towards cover
he wanted a single to cover, but he was sent back by Dilshan
length delivery across the batsman, Sanga leaves it alone this time
good length delivery in the channel again, Dilshan wanted to push at it, but again pulls his bat in at the last moment
full delivery on off, Dilshan would be disappointed as he doesn't time this one, the mid-off fielder moves to his left and prevents any runs
that is a beauty! It seems like it is coming in, but just straightens in the end to beat the outside edge
he follows up a corker with a gentle full delivery wide outside off, Dilshan slams it through cover with disdain
another full delivery outside off, Dilshan brings the bat down with a lot of force, but mistimes it again, it is pushed to mid off
now he gets it in the middle again, full delivery outside off, it's punched down the ground, mid-off just watches it go past
full and inswinging on the stumps, Sanga pushes it calmly past midwicket to pick up a couple
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and pushes it softly towards mid-off
he bowls it just outside off but Sanga covers the line of the stumps and lets it go through
he stays on the back foot and defends the length delivery towards cover point
oh this was not very far from Mills as the batsman pushes it in the air. Sanga just pushes at the full delivery a little early, mid-on fields

length delivery on off, and the batsman just opens the face to push it towards cover point, but he has picked the gap beautifully. The timing tests the two fielders for a while, but they manage to pull it back
short delivery on the body, but it doesn't bounce as much as he expected, hits him high on the thigh pad and rolls behind square on the leg side
tight line around off and it's just back of length, Sanga defends it back to him
this one jags away from the batsman after pitching, but Sanga comfortably lets it go through
length delivery on off, the batsman defends it to point off the front foot
he stands up tall and punches the back of length delivery towards cover where the fielder dives and gets a hand to it to slow it down
oh this was not a bad ball at all, short of length, rising, but Dilshan is on the front foot and punches it through covers, on the up
he oversteps and that's the first free-hit of the day coming up, the batsman pushes it past point for a single
it's a full toss and sligthly slower outside off, Sanga wanted to whack it to deep midwicket, but is completely flummoxed by the lack of pace, it passes under his bat
length delivery across the left-hander, the batsman leaves it alone

'Don't bowl full to Sanga' - that should be some sort of a punishment assignment.. Mills makes the mistake and Sanga plays a copybook drive through cover. He would have picked the gap even if the whole NZ team was placed there, he is that good playing that shot
back of length on the body, it's tucked away to fine leg for a single
full delivery on off, it swings away a touch and that's why Dilshan adjusts late to play it back at the bowler, he was targeting the leg side to start with
fuller length delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to wide mid-off to pick up a single
tries a bit too much on the first delivery, but this one is pushed down the leg side
full and wide outside off, the batsman drives it straight to the man at cover
this one is on the money, angled in and aimed at off stump, Dilshan defends it back to the bowler
full and on the middle and leg line, the batsman whips it to the leg side, but finds the man at square leg
it's full and it's on off and middle, the batsman drives it down the ground, past Sangakkara
punches the length delivery towards off, but the fielder at short cover gets a hand on it to keep the batsmen to a single
length delivery on off, the batsman dabs it towards square leg
length delivery that swings away a little has Dilshan in problems, it flies past the outside edge
this one is shorter and swinging away again, Dilshan wanted to smash it and is disappointed as he doesn't get any bat on that
angled in towards off stump, the batsman comes forward and defends
he is getting a good shape on the ball, the batsman comes forward and defends it with an open face
slightly on the pads, the batsman misses out on his flick shot. The ball brushes the pads and rolls towards the keeper
it's a maiden as he bowls a back of length delivery on off, the batsman defends it towards square leg
it's short and it's on the leg side, the batsman goes for a pull and just gets enough on it to send it to the fine leg boundary
full delivery on the off stump, Sanga waits and clips it through midwicket for a couple
it's on a length wide outside off, the batsman slices it straight to point
he punches this one without much feet movement, but gets a thick outside to the short third-man fielder. There is no protection behind that fielder
short of length and on the body, the batsman tries to work it away to the leg side, but gets hit on the thigh pad
it's on a length, but heading down the leg side. It brushes the pads and rolls to the left of the keeper
pushed through on the pads, turns it to the batsman, who nudges it to midwicket
drifts towards the off stump, but the batsman punches it down to long on off the back foot
again, some drift into the batsman, but the length is slightly short and it allows the batsman to tuck it to backward square leg for a single
short and outside leg stump, that is a filthy delivery and it's flat-batted to the gap at deep backward square leg boundary
tossed up delivery on the middle stump, the batsman comes forward and drives it to deep midwicket
that's a nice one, drifts in and then turns away, past Sanga's outside edge
tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and drives it down to long off
pushed through on off, now Sanga punches it down to long on for a single
flatter and quicker on off, the batsman waits and punches it to cover
veers towards the leg stump and Dilshan, who has taken the helmet off, sweeps it powerfully past the short fine leg fielder's left
oh that was a corker! it drifted in and then turned past the outside edge and it took the glove as well! Ronchi didn't have much chance as it was bouncing extra too. Tough chance
this one spins down the leg side and is called a wide
full delivery wide outside off, Sanga wanted to drive it through cover, but gets a thick outside edge through gully
he wanted to slog sweep this over deep midwicket, but gets an inside edge on to his pads
he is surprised by the turn this time, it comes in sharply and hits him on the thigh pad
fuller delivery on off, it's pushed down to long on
pushed through to off, Sanga defends it solidly
this one is quicker and drifting down the leg side, but the keeper appeals for a catch, nothing on that though
on off stump this time, Sanga defends it towards cover point
tossed up on the middle stump, the batsman punches it down to long on
quicker delivery on off, he punches it off the back foot but can't beat the man at cover
pushes this one back to the left of the bowler, but there is no single again
slightly slower this time and on the leg side, Dilshan misses his flick shot and gets hit on the pad
now it's quicker and on off, the batsman brings his bat down late as he defends
this one is drifting into the batsman too, Dilshan pushes it back to the bowler
he has got a slip but McCullum flights it towards the leg stump, Sanga goes down on his knee and sweeps it fine on the leg side to pick up a boundary
full and on the middle stump, the batsman allows it to come and then flicks it to deep square leg
he waits in the crease for the tossed up delivery and dabs it to the right of short third man for a single
tossed up delivery on off, the batsman defends it solidly
again tossed up on off stump, Sanga comes forward and defends
he waits on the back foot and punches it to deep cover for a single
pushed through on off stump, the batsman defends it towards cover
slower this time, and it has just a little bit of width on it, Sanga waits and cuts it late and all along the ground, all the way to the boundary
quicker delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to the left of mid-off for a single
full and flighted on the stumps, good drift on that, Dilshan drives it to long off for a single

oh he gets an outside edge! But there is no one at slips. Sanga was trying to push it down straight, but played well inside the line. Ellis dives to keep it in at the boundary, but the umpires are checking every camera angle available to them. He has done well
quicker delivery on the middle stump, the batsman defends
tossed up and full on off, the batsman pushes it to long off for a single
lots of flight on this one and a dollop of width too, Dilshan waits and drives it firmly through the gap at cover
and it was a similar delivery, but Dilshan hits it straight to cover this time
quicker and flatter delivery on off, the batsman dabs it towards short third man for a quick single
slower, very slow this time, the batsman comes forward to defend, but the ball bounces extra and the inside edge takes it to short fine
it's a thousand runs for Sanga this year as he pushes it to point for a single
straighter one as Sanga gets rapped on the pads. He was on his front foot, looking to defend, but is beaten but that would have gone down leg
speared down the leg side and it's too easy for the batsman who sweeps it. And the captain Kyle Mills at short fine leg lets it go under him as he dives a little too sluggishly
tossed up outside off and its driven solidly to long-off
hundred up with that good length ball, pitching on leg and turning further away
full and on the pads again as Dilshan flicks it straight to midwicket
cut away strongly. This was a little shorter and he made some room for himself and slapped it behind point
quicker ball, takes the outside edge as there isn't too much turn. New Zealand aren't their usual selves on the fielder. Neesham at short third man misfields
gives it some air on off stump and Sanga pushes it down the ground
lovely bowling there. He made Dilshan reach out as this one was flighted as well. Little turn on offer, as he pushes to cover
and that's his second consecutive fifty, 32nd over all and fifth this year. It was off the inside edge though, but he'll take it as the good length ball squirted away behind square on the leg side
on a good length but on the pads as he works it away to square leg
full and outside off and he pulls out his cover drive, but this one goes straight to the deep fielder
fuller and on off, the batsman pushes it down to the bowler
that's short and that was asking to be sent to the boundary, but Dilshan's pull is cut off by a diving McCullum at midwicket
it's short again, this time he pulls it to deep midwicket for a single
now Sanga gets to his fifty with a neat push past point. It's the hundred of the partnership as well. The Dilly-Sanga show goes on
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
gets it to drift towards off, but Dilshan defends it towards midwicket
he comes down the pitch and takes the flighted delivery on the full to power it down over the bowler's head
pushed through and it drifts towards off, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
flighted and full on the pads, the batsman whips it to deep midwicket for a single
quicker delivery on off, the batsman defends it solidly off the front foot
flatter and quicker on the pads, the batsman is unable to get it away
quicker and on the stumps, the batsman pushes it softly to covers and calls for a single
attempts a yorker, but it's a low full toss that Dilshan can only hit as far as midwicket
he comes round the wicket and bowls a full delivery on the stumps, Sanga pushes it to mid-off and calls for a quick single, but a direct hit would have cut his stay short
beautifully bowled, a good yorker and the batsman can only dig it out as far as point
he walks across to the off side and ramps it to the fine leg boundary, the length was full but not quite, allowed Sanga to get under it
and again, he walks well outside off and even though it's much fuller, he still manages to get under it and finds the fine-leg boundary
bowls a full toss on off which Sanga clubs down to long on for a single
he moves down the leg side, the bowler follows him with a fuller delivery, but Sanga just flicks it over midwicket, it is timed so well that it just bounces once before hitting the boundary
he makes room by moving outside leg, but the bowler bowls a slower bouncer which keeps going away from him, the batsman can only dab it as far as point
another slower bouncer, the batman waits to get some bat on that , but misses. Dilshan raises his bat way over his head, and gets the decision in his favour
another slower bouncer and again Dilshan misses it, the ball gripped the surface
bowls it full this time and Dilshan fails to get any bat on that. Everyone is inside the circle on off and had Dilshan got any bat on that, it could have gone to the boundary
bowls a shorter delivery, Dilshan pulls, but everyone is deep on the leg side, so only a single to deep midwicket
he gets way across his stumps and gets hit on the helmet as he tries to ramp the short ball, manages only a single

inn2.comm: fuller delivery swinging into the left hander, who pushes it to mid-off and calls for a quick one
there comes a full delivery, it's not a yorker, but it's a full toss and a quick one, swinging in to the left hander, who pushes it to cover for a quick single
and there it is! Right on the money! the batsman digs it out with an angular bat and gets full value as the ball flies fine on the off side past the first slip fielder for a boundary
short delivery, the batsman hops on his toes and steers it to third man for a single
inswinging and aimed at the toes, the batsman just digs it out in time. A similar delivery knocked him over in the first match. There will be more of that stuff
and another one, this one is on the middle stump, Devcich doesn't try anything fancy, just pushes it to mid-off with the straightest of bats
starts off with that away swinger that the batsman gets a thick edge on, Malinga does well at the boundary to keep the batsmen to a single

he strikes straightaway, it's a typical Kula delivery. It's pitched around leg stump, then snakes away viciously. Devcich remained rooted to the crease and followed the ball, but could only edge it to the keeper

and another one gone! Nicol charged Kula on the first delivery, but this one was short and moved away from the right-hander, the batsman gets a fine edge to the keeper and Sanga is ecstatic. Excellent presence of mind from Kula who spotted the batsman's movement
this one is a big inswinger and the batsman is hit on the pads, but that swung too much
a straighter one this time, the batsman appears inadequate in handling this swing, he is beaten
he is rapped on the pads with a booming inswinger again, but that is too much swing again and it saves Elliot
starts off with a gentle length delivery outside off, the batsman steers it down to third man for a single
some hesitation as the batsmen sneak a single. This length delivery came in and the batsman missed his flick, the ball only rolled down the pitch
back of length on off, the batsman stays on the back foot and defends
fuller length delivery and the batsman gets an inside edge to midwicket as he tries to push it to off
another inside edge, this one rolls towards wide mid-on and they take an easy single
he comes down the pitch, but the ball swings into him and messes his timing, he can only push it as far as mid on for a single
he keeps swinging it away from the left-handers, big booming swing for him, the batsman tries to follow it but it runs away from him and he is beaten
he is flying a kite, this Kula, the batsman charges down but Kula swings it sharply away from him, he is got it on a string
back of length this time and the batsman decides to wait on the back foot and defend
big swing, but the batsman plays it late and punches it with a lot of timing. That went flying through covers, some power behind that too
he takes his front leg out of the way and slices the length delivery to point, Dilshan does well at point to stop it as there was a lot of power behind that shot too
bowls length outside off, swings away slightly and Latham gets a thick outside edge to third man
oh that's a brute! He was expecting a full delivery, but it was short, and it kept swinging into the body. Latham takes his eyes off and gets hit on his arm by that one
another short one, and it slightly outside off, Latham waits for that and cracks it behind point, he used the bowler's speed on that one and it beats Kula at third man easily
another short delivery, this time on his body, Latham tucks it to backward square leg for a quick single.

oh loud appeal for lbw, but the batsman is hit on his arm! It was a slower delivery, looked like a beamer to start with, the batsman lost it completely and tried to duck out of the way, but it dipped on him and hit his left arm. The height was ok on that , but that would have gone down the leg side
fuller and swinging in on the middle stump, the batsman drives it through midwicket, more of an inside edge actually
short delivery and this is the first wayward one as it swings down the leg side
slower yorker on off stump, the batsman spots it in time and digs it out to point
that spray seems to have worked, he charges down the pitch and slaps the length delivery through covers with some force
he walks across the stumps, but the ball swings into him big time and he misses his flick
tries to send it in the jungles adjacent to the ground, gives it one mighty swing but he is nowhere near to the line of the ball, he is beaten
swings in from back of length, the batsman whips it to fine leg for a single
that away movement keeps causing trouble for Latham as he pushes inside the line and is beaten
he takes a couple of steps down the pitch and drives the length delivery to long off for a single
flatter delivery on the stumps, cramps the batsman for room and forces him to defend
he takes a forward step and chips it to long on for a single
he bowls it full and flighted, the batsman pushes it to cover

tossed up and slower! much slower than normal and Elliot was aiming for an inside out drive through cover, but misses the ball completely, the momentum dragging him out. In the end, he is a yard down the pitch and Sanga does it easily. He missed the stumps first time, but he still had enough time to take the bails off
he pushes the first ball  to cover
fuller and flighted on the off, the batsman punches it back to the bowler
short and wide from Dilshan, the batsman slaps it straight to cover point, misses out
shorter, but on the stumps, the batsman makes room by moving towards the leg and punches it through cover. Once it beats the infield, it keeps running
he skips down the pitch and drags this flighted one from outside off to wide mid-on, again, once it beats the man, it runs away to the boundary
third boundary in a row, this one was wide from the bowler and Latham slashes it through backward point. It was in the air for a bit, but it drops short of Malinga and runs away
waits on the back foot and pushes this to deep cover for a single
he stays in the crease and defends the quicker delivery towards point
he tries to ramp it over the keeper's head from wide outside off, but gets hit on the belly
now moves outside leg and punches it through the gap at point for a couple
fuller and drifting away from the left-hander, he manages to slice it towards point for a quick single
whoa! he switches his stance and smashes it to deep point! That is some powerful right-hander's slog sweep
drifting on to the pads and the batsman fails to get it away
again the switch hit, this time he doesn't get full hold of it, but it's good enough to take it to the boundary at deep point
length delivery on the pads, it's clipped away to deep square leg for a single
a misfield at mid-off allows the batsmen a couple, there was no run on that one as the batsman punched it firmly straight at the fielder, the deflection carried the ball to long on
slower delivery on off, the batsman pushes it to wide mid-off for a single
he wanted to smash it over long on, but he moves away from the delivery too much and misses the line
slaps this short of length delivery to deep square leg for a single
back of length delivery on the body, it's quicker too and cramps him for room, but he dabs it to the off side for a single
quicker and flatter on the body, the batsman whips it to deep square leg off the back foot
slower and on the stumps, he gets good bounce on those ones, the batsman nudges it straight to point
floated up to the batsman, who sweeps it down to deep backward square leg for a single
he drifts this one into the batsman, who went for a hoick, but he misses it and the ball misses the leg stump

tries to attempt the same shot and gets hold of it this time, but there is a fielder waiting at deep midwicket, where he is taken comfortably. He probably didn't get enough power on that as Sena bowled it slightly slower than the previous one
quicker delivery on off stumps, the batsman defends it off the back foot
length delivery on the pads and it's flicked fine on the leg side, and there is no one there in the deep, boundary to start his innings
back of length delivery on off, the batsman stands tall and punches it to mid-off for a quick single
slower delivery on the stumps, the batsman pushes it to midwicket for a single
fuller delivery and it's neatly clipped over midwicket, the fielder from deep square leg comes around to does the clean-up job at the boundary
and again he chips the fuller delivery to long on, for a single
back of length delivery on the stumps, no room in that one, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
tossed up delivery on off, it's the straighter one, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
slower and on the pads, the batsman has to wait before flicking it to deep square leg
quicker one on the pads, the batsman pushes it to midwicket
quicker one, this is the other one, Herath's carrom ball, the batsman can only defend it to off
he stretches towards the pitch of the delivery to sweep it to deep square leg
slower this time, Ronchi punches it to long on for a single
short of length delivery outside off, Ronchi punches it to deep cover for a single
slower delivery on off, the batsman can only push it as far as cover
he charges down the pitch and swats the length delivery to long on, only for a single though
fuller and outside off, Ronchi crunches a drive to deep point but again, it's straight to the fielder
tries to slog it to the leg side, but gets an under edge on that one, it just misses the leg stump, but that comes as bonus runs as it runs away to the boundary
another slower ball, the batsman comes down the pitch and punches to long off
fuller delivery, it's swept firmly to deep backward square leg and Latham brings up his half-century
quicker and flatter on the pads, Ronchi slaps it to the leg side, but again he picks out the fielder at deep backward square leg
and he breaks the spell with a powerful sweep between the square leg and deep midwicket fielder
he serves up a juicy full toss, and Latham loves it as he pulls out a baseball style hit, all the way over the deep midwicket boundary. That slipped off the bowler's hand
he chips down the track and punches it to long on for a single
he calmly takes a forward step and chips it inside out over extra cover for a couple of runs
bowls a slower delivery on the pads, the batsman gets some bat on it as it rolls down the leg side to the right of the keeper
it's the slower full toss, the batsman chips it to long on for a single
another slower delivery, the batsman punches it straight to point
he bowls a full one on off, the batsman wanted to push it to long off, but gets an inside edge towards midwicket
full delivery on the pads, not a good idea when the fine leg is up in the circle, Ronchi flicks it fine and that's four
whoaa! He sees that slower delivery early and picks it up straight down the ground, as straight as it gets and it descends around the sight screen
he comes down the pitch straightaway and chips it towards cow corner for a couple of runs
fuller outside off, but the batsman drags it from there to deep backward square leg with an agricultural sweep shot
oh that is brilliantly timed through wide mid-off, not much wrong with the delivery, Ronchi just punches it after clearing his front leg
bowls it flat and quick on off, the batsman punches it back to the bowler
shorter and quicker on off, and again Ronchi threads that tiny gap at cover, it was a mere push, but this outfield is still like a billiards table
full and flighted delivery, Ronchi keeps making it better for NZ, he chips it over the infield at extra cover and finds the third boundary of the over
starts off with one in the block hole, the batsman jams his bat down in time
oh this is a full toss and that is slapped straight back at the bowler, the batsman hops over it and saves his feet, but that is a boundary too
and another one! It's a half-volley and it's smashed back down the ground. Not much swing for Kula now
full toss again, the batsman charges down and makes room, he slices it through point powerfully for his third boundary in a row
length delivery on the leg stump, he pushes it softly to midwicket for a single
and the fourth boundary in the over, but this one is off a thick outside edge. The third man was inside the circle and had no chance
length delivery on off, it's a slower one, Latham pushes it to cover
he bowls a quicker one this time, and Latham fishes for that one outside off, makes no contact
he comes down the pitch and slices the widish delivery over cover for a couple
length delivery on off, he stays in the crease and punches it to deep point for a single. The batsmen were looking for a second, but Chandimal is quick at the boundary
slower delivery, but it's a half-volley and Ronchi spots it early, he chooses to go straight down the ground and beats the long off fielder comfortably
length delivery on off, he pulls that one to the leg side, gets a big top edge, but that one falls safely around deep midwicket
tries the yorker, but it's wide full toss. Latham would be disappointed as he slices it straight to point, could have smashed it anywhere
another quick and low full toss on off and again the batsman slices it to point. Two men there, very close to each other, hard to pick a gap between them
bowls a full delivery outside off, it keeps going away from the batsman and Ronchi misses
and another low full toss, this one angles away from the right-hander, he is stealing the momentum from NZ here
another yorker on off stump, Ronchi can only squeeze it out to point for a single
tries to bowl a wide yorker, but pushes it too far away, called a wide
and another one too wide outside off, another extra ball
and this time he gets his direction right, it's full, it's a touch wide outside off and it beats the bat
and another full delivery wide outside off and again Ronchi fails to make contact
length delivery wide outside off, Ronchi finally gets some bat on it as he aims for the big hit down the ground, but he doesn't get much power on that, the long-off fielder gobbles it up with ease
he slices the full delivery and the pace on that ball takes it quickly to the third man boundary, ordinary effort their by Herath there
wider delivery outside off, the batsman attempts to punch it through off and misses it

full and wide, Latham slices it in the air and that's a mistake as it goes straight to Senanayake at point. Latham was trying to pick that gap at point in the last over too, but this time he tries to go over it and doesn't get the elevation
full delivery wide outside off, the batsman slices it to point and takes off for a quick single
he fires a yorker on off and it's slightly off the mark, a low full toss, but the batsman flicks it over midwicket and finds the boundary
he walks down the pitch and gets a slower yorker, the batsman gets hit on the pad and it rolls towards point
yorker after yorker after yorker, the batsman jams it out towards deep point for a single
and this one is full and aimed at the leg stump, McCullum pushes it to midwicket for a single
and another full delivery outside off, Neesham can only take a single to extra cover
full delivery, but it's slightly off the length, McCullum moves to the leg side and gets under it and whacks it over the bowler's head for a boundary
full and flighted, driven firmly to midwicket, who is not able to collect it cleanly and palms it to long on
full yorker by the spinner, he can only push it to cover for a single, good delivery that one
oh he gets the six NZ needed! He moves to the leg side and smashes the full delivery inside out over extra cover, that is an excellent shot in the situation, keeps the game alive
he is keeping the game alive here, he moves the leg side, and slaps the length ball just over the extra cover fielder, who was leaping for that, but once it crosses him, it's a four
he gets six, NZ have tied. McCullum is actually doing a Brendon! He makes room and smashes Herath over long-off
and he finishes it with another six, he swats this full toss over long on
